channel.title: Adding Timers?
channel.description: I have seen many things that have Timers in them but all of those have been deleted :( Anyway I would like to know how to add a timer, so like when you start out you have 0 and when you yell next to your name it says [NEWB] and then after a minute or the time i would like it says [COOL GUY] You know what i mean? Please help me lolz ;D

item.title: Adding Timers?
item.dc:creator: @Hiaburi Hiaburi
item.description:
@Hiaburi wrote:

um to save the var look for hasegg a few times and you should see a bunch of buffered read things, copy the entire one for has egg, which is like 2 lines and replace hasegg in it with the name of ur var, then search again until you find a bunch of lines with token, copy the line with hasegg, and 2 lines after it, and paste it right below it, then replace hassegg in it with your var name again and it should save

Read full topic

item.title: Adding Timers?
item.dc:creator: @jungledude jungledude
item.description:
@jungledude wrote:

Yes, that helped very much! Now if i can just get it to save it would be great!

Read full topic

item.title: Adding Timers?
item.dc:creator: @Hiaburi Hiaburi
item.description:
@Hiaburi wrote:

add an int, like

public int mytimer = 0;

then go to public boolean process and add

if (mytimer >= 1){mytimer--;}

then go add

mytimer++;

to anything you want to increase the timer, then just add a few more ifs in a void then declare it in public boolean process, like

if (mytimer >= 10)
{
sendMessage("Slow Down!");
}

probly not the best way but i used it for like 50 things and it worked for me…

Read full topic

try something like with weapondelay or pkingdelay, or lowertime();, just make the void…
